rooms.description: A modest open space near the entrance for greeting guests. It includes minimalistic design elements inspired by Brutalist aesthetics, with raw concrete finishes and geometric forms.

Spacious living area with exposed concrete structures and sharp angles; serves as a multipurpose space. Large windows provide ample natural light while adhering to Vastu guidelines ensuring positive energy flow.
Compact yet efficient kitchen, designed with raw finishes and functional layout. Its placement is in the southeast corner to ensure good health and balance per Vastu norms.

Adjacent to the living room for a seamless dining experience; its design includes high ceilings and concrete beams, aligning with Brutalist style while considering energy flow as recommended by Vastu.

Spacious balcony attached to the bedroom on ground floor providing a private outdoor space. The balcony features a minimalist design, with reinforced concrete railings and subtle greenery to enhance energy flow.

Open area designated for an in-ground swimming pool. Includes perimeter seating and deck area integrated into the garden landscape; design respects budget constraints while ensuring a Brutalist aesthetic with raw materials.

openings.description: Large entrance door, reinforced concrete structure, placed to harness the auspicious energies as per Vastu guidelines.
Multiple windows with steel frames; placement enhances natural light and maintains Vastu alignment by ensuring balanced energy flow in living spaces.
Strategically placed window to facilitate efficient ventilation as per local norms and Vastu requirements.
